title: Do all places have the same dates? - Quora

response.answer_text: well, do you mean the same calendar? Then yes, every place follows the same dates, even if they might have a ‘religious’ calendar that is different. If you mean does everyplace have the same date at THIS MOMENT, then no. The International Dateline separates the globe into today and tomorrow (or tomorrow and today). There are 24 Time Zones, one for each hour of the day. The day “begins” in Australia, but it’s a big country (as large as the US), with several Time Zones. So, when it is 12am Tuesday in Brisbane (East coast), it is still 10PM Monday night in Perth. Another example would be: I’m in St. Louis, where it is 11pm on Monday night. But in New York City it is 12am Tuesday morning.
